content:
I wrote some notes and left them at the rust nonofficial wiki:
https://runrust.miraheze.org/wiki/Rust_installation_special_notes_in_China
I don't actually know who in the official teams might be interested in this. Maybe @XAMPPRocky or @Pietro Albini wants to have a read :)
I'm not confident endorsing third party mirrors of releases or crates.io, as our tooling doesn't validate signatures
and there would be no automatic way to detect malicious content in those mirrors
Sure, all of these are non-official. They're just currently state of art :)
Yeah, we don't need to endorse anything. I do think it would be nice to have mirroring instructions somewhere on the install page.
I wouldn't want any mirror URL in the website
I think we'd be fine with example.com.
then what's the point of explaining how to setup a mirror without linking to anyone? people would have to go find the mirror on their own, and that page can explain how to set it up
Maybe just showing that the environment variables are actually exist and are configurable?
Well actually i'm not trying to argue for any change here, just want to write the text down so people can gain a better understanding of the current situation.
In many cases we can't even open rust-lang.org lol :)

Yeah, but I feel this is a common enough question (including the alternative crates.io registries) to warrant inclusion on the install FAQ, and then other places don't have to explain how to set up, they can just link to our documentation which will typically be more current and up to date, they just have to provide the user the URL.

Charles Lew said:

In many cases we can't even open rust-lang.org lol :slight_smile:

That's because it's hosted on Heroku right?
Not really sure about the website case, generally most hosting providers are blocked if they offer free service.
I'm currently using a proxy to visit Zulip :)
I've heard from others unable to get access that mentioned Heroku being the issue.
@Charles Lew Do you need a proxy to visit github/github pages as well?
github largely not needed, sometimes slow. github pages and release downloads are sometimes unconnectable.
many times
(we'll want to place cloudfront in front of gh pages, if we move the website there btw)
cdn services, like cloudfront is usually unconnectable.
Sometimes i wish Rust is just a Mozilla product, so Mozilla China (mozilla.com.cn) will offer the services :( Too bad it's not true.
Firefox in China have separate servers for account management, and things like that.
Well, thanks a lot for listening~ Actually Rust is already attractive enough and people will find way to use it :)
